title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the National Treasury Management Agency
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Treasury Management Agency 

(Delegation of Claims Management Functions) Order 2024.
text_norm: 1 order may cited national treasury management agency (delegation claim management functions) order 2024

title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: In this Order, “Minister” means the Minister for Finance.
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order, “Minister” means the Minister for Finance.

title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: 3. This Order applies to a claim, other than a claim referred to in Article 4,
text_raw:
3. This Order applies to a claim, other than a claim referred to in Article 4, 

that – 

(a) 

is made against – 

the State authority specified in the Schedule either alone or 
with any other person, and 

the Minister, where the claim referred to in subparagraph (i) 
is also made against the Minister, 

(i) 

(ii) 

and 

(b) 

either - 

(i) 

(ii) 

is made before the making of this Order and is one in 
respect of which the Agency and the State authority 
concerned determine that it should be managed by the 
Agency, or 

is made after the making of this Order irrespective of 
whether it relates to an act, omission or other matter 
occurring before or after such making.
text_norm: 3 order applies claim claim referred article 4 - (a) made - state authority specified schedule either alone person minister claim referred subparagraph (i) also made minister (i) (ii) (b) either - (i) (ii) made making order one respect agency state authority concerned determine managed agency made making order irrespective whether relates act omission matter occurring making

title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: 4. The following classes of claims are exempted from the delegation
text_raw:
4. The following classes of claims are exempted from the delegation 

effected by this Order: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 5th July, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [337] 3 

(a) 

claims made against the Minister or the State authority specified 
in the Schedule in respect of personal injury which include a 
claim in relation to liability for – 

(i) 

defective products, 

(ii) 

injurious falsehood, 

(iii) malicious prosecution, 

(iv) malicious abuse of the civil process, 

(v) deceit, or 

(vi) defamation; 

(b) 

claims made against the Minister in respect of personal injury 
suffered by an employee of the State or of the Government caused 
by a breach of the Employment Equality Act 1998 (No. 21 of 
1998).
text_norm: 4 following class claim exempted delegation effected order notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 5th july 2024 337 3 (a) claim made minister state authority specified schedule respect personal injury include claim relation liability - (i) defective product (ii) injurious falsehood (iii) malicious prosecution (iv) malicious abuse civil process (v) deceit (vi) defamation (b) claim made minister respect personal injury suffered employee state government caused breach employment equality act 1998 (no 21 1998)

title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: 5. The management of a claim to which this Order applies is delegated to
text_raw:
5. The management of a claim to which this Order applies is delegated to 

the Agency.
text_norm: 5 management claim order applies delegated agency

title: against the Minister or the State authority specified in the Schedule, functions in
heading: It is declared that the Agency shall have the functions specified in section
text_raw:
6. 

It is declared that the Agency shall have the functions specified in section 
9(2)(a) of the National Treasury Management Agency (Amendment) Act 2000 
(No. 39 of 2000). 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [337]
